definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: Teachers become facilitators of learning in this language-arts context.
sentences.chinese: 老師爲學習的便利在這語言藝術上下文上下功夫。

sentences.english: Purchasing Guide is needed in the aspects.
sentences.chinese: 導購員必需在這方面下功夫。

sentences.english: We must take pains to do meticulous work among the masses.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須下功夫在羣衆中做細緻的工作。

sentences.english: And much more research is made on the running mechanism of ESOP.
sentences.chinese: 更多的研究是在員工持股的運行機制上下功夫。

sentences.english: When you work on it every week, you will be stronger.
sentences.chinese: 如果每週都在這上面下功夫，那你會越來越強。

sentences.english: There's a very strong scripted feel, much effort was put into rehearsal.
sentences.chinese: 劇本感很強，之前的排練很下功夫。

sentences.english: Wanting to get something for free.
sentences.chinese: 不下功夫而想得到所要的東西。

sentences.english: Pisces tends to focus much energy on understanding and sympathizing with their partner.
sentences.chinese: 雙魚更容易在理解和相惜同伴方面多下功夫。

sentences.english: I spent more time on the subject I was not good at.
sentences.chinese: 我在不太擅長的科目上狠下功夫。

sentences.english: "You've got to get better at hiring people, " she told him.
sentences.chinese: 祖母告訴他，“在僱人幹活這方面，你還得下功夫。”

sentences.english: If you don't work hard now, you'll suffer for it later.
sentences.chinese: 你現在不下功夫，日後會喫苦頭的。

sentences.english: It requires efforts to master a language .
sentences.chinese: 掌握一門語言須要下功夫。

sentences.english: First and foremost, I think you should work harder on your biology.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我認爲你應該多在生物學上下功夫。

sentences.english: It works in the minutest crannies and it opens out the widest vistas.
sentences.chinese: 它在最細微的地方下功夫，而展開了最寬廣的遠景。

sentences.english: Starting from this place, make great efforts to practice will be gradually effective.
sentences.chinese: 從這個地方入手，狠下功夫，修行就會漸漸得力。

definition: to put in time and energy/to concentrate one's efforts
of the utmost importance/of highest priority
to perfect sth that is already outstanding (idiom); constantly improving
to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
short stave of the barrel (which allows the contents to escape)/(fig.) shortcoming/weak point
to raise one and infer three/to deduce many things from one case (idiom)
to attach importance to sth/to value
